bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Diana Bermudez' career in philanthropy has included positions as a program officer, consultant, and Board Member. From 1988 to 1993, she worked as a Program Officer in the Ford Foundation's Urban Poverty Program. While at the Ford Foundation, Bermudez oversaw grantmaking for community development with a particular focus on support to community development corporations (CDCs).

After leaving the Ford Foundation, Bermudez continued overseeing grantmaking for community development when she became a Program Officer at the Evelyn and Walter Haas Jr. Fund in 1994. She left this position in 1999 and started her own philanthropic and nonprofit organization consulting firm, Diana Bermudez Consulting. In 2016, Bermudez retired from her firm, and in 2018 she joined the Board of Directors of the Y & H Soda Foundation.
Bermudez earned a B.A. in Biology from the University of California, Santa Cruz in 1979 and a Master's Degree in public health from the University of California, Berkeley in 1981.
